attributes.action: Review the role and structure of the CAA following the UK’s exit from the EU
attributes.additional_details:
The direction of aviation has changed. On visiting the CAA Web site many pages are marked for review.
 
The CAA is a public corporation of the Department for Transport, and the UK government is solely responsible for the direction the CAA takes. The Government must review the role and structure of the CAA in light of the UK’s exist from the EU, so it can give clear direction to the CAA to ensure that it is ready for its new role in aviation.
attributes.background: We call on the Government to review the role and structure of the CAA in light of the UK’s departure from the EU, with a view to identifying any reforms that might be necessary or desirable.
